dialog_nodes.title: home maker did not tell anyone - she will fight?

values.text: Try to talk about it to your trustworthy family member.

I am here to support you.
You are alone enough to get yourself out of this.
Do not worry.
There are 20% women in India who are tolerating the domestic violence inside four walls, but I am proud of you that you shared your feelings with me.

You do not have to be scared of anything.It is your life and you have the right to live it peacefully with a right partner.
You deserve respect and care, if you are not getting it you should move on in your life.

You can contact the following helpline numbers for woman safety agencies and later can file a case against him and those who have tortured you.
1. **Human Rights Law Network runs Madhyam Helpline and provide Legal Services	(011) 24316922/ 24324503**
2. **Lawyers Collective Womens Rights Initiative LC WRI runs a pro-bono legal aid cell for domestic violence cases	(011) 24373993/ 24372923**
3. **Central Social Welfare Board -Police Helpline	1091/ 1291, (011) 23317004**


**Do not step back!**
**You can do it for yourself?**

dialog_nodes.title: if home maker talked about it to someone

values.text: Did you get any type of help from that person?
Was that helpful?

It was great talking to you. Thank you for your service ! Stay safe ! 
Always remember this, 
**"The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of other."** -  Mahatma Gandhi

We are really proud of you ! Thank You. 
Always remember this, 
**"We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give."** - Winston Churchill

It is one of the most noble professions and you get to save many lives which everyone can't do. You are stronger than you think. This is a hard phase but this will pass soon. Remember that you are making this world a better place to live for people you treat.

values.text:
You cannot let anyone hurt you like this.
Do not let others control you.You have told me about it , now you need little more courage to speak up against it and to stop it.
You get only one life to live.

**You will fight for your freedom and respect**
Start Loving yourself first!!
You can and you will do it, I know.

dialog_nodes.title: home maker will fight for it

values.text:
Your journey against Domestic violence starts from now...
Always remember 
**“The enemy doesn’t stand a chance when the victim decides to survive.” ** — Rae Smith
**GOOD LUCK!!**
Please remember that what you are going through today is just a bad phase and it will pass by very soon, and on the other side of this suffering is happiness, and glory.
Please try to start meditating. It will really help you with your stress, depression and anxiety.  Look for inner peace in this time of distress.
Believe in yourself, that you are  stronger than what you think. This too shall pass and you will come out of this phase much stronger than before.
I hope that you have understood your value in the world right now. I also hope that you will be stronger from now and take care of yourself.
You have been gifted with this noble profession of saving lives and treating people, so please remember why you chose this profession.
Did you tell anyone?
Did you talk to anyone?

I know that we all are having such a hard time with this,but worrying does not empty tomorrow of its sorrow, it empties today of its strength.
Stay at Home and take good care of you and family.

I can completely understand your state of mind,but are a 'Home Maker' if you will dwell in problems,your family will worry more.
Always remember ,"Tough times never last, but tough people do."
YOU are a TOUGH Woman!!

Stay Positive and this, too, shall pass away.
Okay?
What is your profession ?
Whats bothering you ?
So,how can i help you?

I understand what you are going through. Please stay strong, and take sufficient care of yourself as you are in close contact with the patients. But people need you as no one else can replace you in doing your work. You have the chance to save many lives, and please take necessary precautions and stay motivated.

I understand that, and agree that it is quite difficult. But at this time, you need to be strong and think more practically about the situation around rather than being emotional. Staying away from them is for their safety, as you are in close contact with patients. Look at it in a positive perspective that You really love them, and this is also a way of expressing your love and care for them. When all this chaos has passed, you will be able to meet them and stay happy and healthy with them. So think of it as a sacrifice you are making today for a better tomorrow.

That is really saddening to hear. But this is the time you need to be strong and YOU are a hero, and you are an inspiration to many people. Please be strong and take care of yourself. You are needed to save this world.

I can understand what you are going through. But you are like God to the people who are infected and you have a chance to save their lives, and ultimately, that is the noble motto of a health care professional, to save as many lives as possible in a situation like this. So please, take care of yourself and stay strong.

You are an ultimate hero and you need to take care of yourself and people around you. You are next to god for them and you have a chance to fight for a noble cause and save people's lives, which is possible only by you.

You cannot let anyone hurt you like this.
Do not let others control you.You have told me about it , now you need little more courage to speak up against it and to stop it.
You get only one life to live.

**You will fight for your freedom and respect**

Your journey against Domestic violence starts from now...
Always remember 

**“The enemy doesn’t stand a chance when the victim decides to survive.” ** — Rae Smith

Please contact this helpline number and tell them your location, and they will make sure that sufficient PPEs are delivered to you immediately. **1800-120-444-222.** They operate from 8am to 8pm. Also, at this point of time, with the situation around, there is a scarcity in masks and PPEs, so please don't depend on the PPEs provided by the hospitals alone, and purchase them individually too for your protection.

I think it would be better if you can talk to someone who has a solution for you, please consider taking help from our counselors, as they are very experienced in providing a solution to what you are undergoing. Reach out to them at **+918025497777** any time of the day, and any day of the week.

It was great talking to you. Thank you for your service ! Stay safe ! 
Always remember this, 
**"The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of other."** -  Mahatma Gandhi

We are really proud of you ! Thank You. 
Always remember this, 
**"We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give."* - Winston Churchill

dialog_nodes.title: home maker has no symptoms just scared

values.text:
Take good care of yourself, eat healthy diet to make your immune system strong.Sanitize hands and your home also regularly.
**Stay at Home!**

Constant monitoring of news and social media feeds can quickly turn compulsive and counterproductive—fueling anxiety rather than easing it.
I would suggest you to limit your media time and spend time in doing what you love.

**Do not panic!**
If you find any Covid-19 symptoms in you or any family member, immediately contact your nearby doctor.

*Central Helpline Number for corona-virus: - +91-11-23978046*

You can also check the following links for helpline numbers and more information -
1.(https://www.mohfw.gov.in/pdf/coronvavirushelplinenumber.pdf)
